item.title: Sniper Elite Resistance: Investigate The Train Station Walkthrough (Mission 3)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How to Find the Cargo Transportation Documents in Sniper Elite Resistance

Sniper Elite Resistance mission 3: Sonderzuge Sabotage has multiple sets of objectives ranging from infiltrating Hotel Terminus to finding clues on the superweapon. One of these objectives requires players to investigate the Fourviere Train Station to search to find out why the area is heavily guarded by Nazis. Players must infiltrate the station to find the Cargo Transportation Documents and eliminate any threats on the way.

How to Find the Cargo Transportation Documents in Sniper Elite Resistance

Players will find the train station building northeast of the map in Sniper Elite Resistance mission 3. The building has a handful of Nazi soldiers patrolling both floors of the train station. So, it's important that you take them out first before looking for the Cargo Transportation Documents. Here's how you can safely complete Investigate the Train Station objective in the Sonderzuge Sabotage mission.

Clearing the Train Station's First Floor

Once you enter the building, you'll find the first soldier patrolling the reception area, near the cash register. You can either use your suppressed pistol to take out the patrolling enemy, or simply use melee takedown. Either way, do this quietly to avoid alerting the guard patrolling the second floor.

Now, you'll spot a small dark office on the first floor, opposite the stairs leading up to the second floor. Inside the office, you can sabotage the electric panel on the wall, prompting the soldier on the second floor to investigate the disturbance. Once the soldier comes inside the office, take them out as well.

Finding the Cargo Transportation Documents

After the coast is clear, head to the second floor to find the Cargo Transportation Documents in Sniper Elite Resistance mission 3. Once you reach the second floor, you can check the right side of the benches to find a locked stash. Inside the stash, you'll get a suppressed rifle (found weapon), and some other lootable items.

Heading to the left side of the benches, you'll enter a small office with some documents lying on the table. Once you grab the Cargo Transportation Documents, Hawker will comment on how this is a manifest indicating that the Germans are moving the mysterious cargo to Site D. It'll also mark the objective as complete, allowing you to move on to the next objective in Sniper Elite Resistance mission 3.

item.title: Hello Kitty Island Adventure: How To Get Sticks
item.description:
Hello Kitty Island Adventure has many different materials that are required to craft different things within the game. Players will also need materials such as wood to be able to exchange it for pieces of furniture to decorate their houses or visitor cabins.

Each material can be found in different biomes across the island, requiring a bit of a hunt for each one that players need to find. For some quests, players will be required to search for 10 sticks to make their fishing rod or their bug net. However, it can be difficult to find the amount that players need without knowing where to look. Thankfully, this guide is here to help out, and will tell you everything you need to know about finding sticks in Hello Kitty Island Adventure.

How To Get Sticks

Hello Kitty Island Adventure will have many quests pop up throughout the game, including the ones that give players their tools, which will require quite a bit of wood when players first start the game. Sticks can mainly be found around trees , having fallen from the branches and now lying on the ground. They will be found in different areas around the Seaside Resort , but there is a limit of only about 15 sticks per day, making it difficult to always have enough without using other sources for them.

There are other ways to get sticks in Hello Kitty Island Adventure . This is through a mini-game called "Crane Craze," which players can get by finishing the game and can receive sticks as a prize. Some players can gift certain characters to receive sticks, such as Lou, but only when he is visiting the island.

Players also have a chance of getting a total of 5 sticks from opening Time Capsules or Corune Capsules from Poron and Corune. These aren't a guaranteed source for sticks though. Some puzzle rooms will also have sticks which can be found around different places. Here are some places to look:

  • Crumble Rumble
  • Thermal Throwdown
  • Flooded Fulcrum
  • Lightning Lockout

This last source of stick is a bit odd compared to the rest. Players can actually find sticks in Hello Kitty Island Adventure by catching fish. Sometimes, when players catch a fish, it will drop a stick if it doesn't drop a different item—this mainly happens with Clamfish. Here's a list of different Clamfish that can drop sticks:

  • Coastal Clamfish
  • Bog Clamfish
  • Briny Clamfish
  • Cavern Clamfish
  • Magma Clamfish

These are all the different ways that players can be rewarded with sticks in Hello Kitty Island Adventure, and they'll eventually end up using all of these methods as they craft their way through the game.

item.title: Marvel Rivals is Missing One Underrated Team With Huge Potential
item.description:
Marvel Rivals has done a great job pulling from some of Marvel's deeper cuts to bring more obscure characters into the spotlight. Characters like Luna Snow and Jeff the Land Shark weren't the most well-known heroes prior to their inclusion in Marvel Rivals , but they've quickly risen to become fan favorites. However, there is a lesser-known Marvel team that has yet to be represented in Marvel Rivals , and they hold massive potential to become unique, beloved characters among players.

While teams like The Avengers, The Fantastic Four, and the X-Men get most of the attention from Marvel fans, the Inhumans are another important group within the Marvel universe. The Inhumans are a race of genetically altered humans created by the Kree to fight the Skrulls before eclipsing their creators in power and becoming abandoned on the isolated island city of Attilan. While many Inhumans now exist thanks to the development of the Terrigen Mist that can unlock the latent Inhuman powers of the human population, there are a few key members of the group that deserve to join Marvel Rivals ' roster.

Marvel Rivals Could Do a Lot With the Inhumans

Inhuman Characters that Should Join Marvel Rivals' Roster

  • Black Bolt
  • Medusa
  • Maximus
  • Crystal
  • Lockjaw

As the king of the Inhumans, Black Bolt seems like the obvious choice for a Marvel Rivals representative, and his signature scream could be a powerful ultimate. The queen of the Inhumans, Medusa, would also be a good fit for Marvel Rivals , as the ability to control her prehensile hair could potentially make her a Duelist version of Venom. Black Bolt's brother and Inhumans villain Maximus could make a great addition to the game's Strategist roster, as his mind control and psychic manipulation powers could be used to buff teammates and debuff enemies.

Medusa's sister, Crystal, could have a very diverse Marvel Rivals kit, as her ability to control the four major elements means she can wield water, fire, earth, and air powers. Lockjaw is the Inhuman's teleporting dog and loyal companion of Crystal, who could potentially be another fan-favorite character like Jeff the Land Shark and boast a kit that could allow him to teleport allies around the map, somewhat like a toned-down version of Doctor Strange's portal. With so much untapped character potential both mechanically and lore-wise, leaving the Inhumans out of Marvel Rivals would feel like a waste of potential.

Why the Inhumans Are a Perfect Fit for Marvel Rivals

Not only are the Inhumans nearly as ubiquitous as mutants in the Marvel universe, but their unique relationship with Terrigen Mist could make for an interesting gameplay mechanic in Marvel Rivals . Terrigen Mist unlocks the latent Inhuman powers of humans, but it also amplifies the powers of existing Inhumans as well. This reaction to the Terrigen Mist could be the perfect basis for a Team-Up mechanic that allows Inhuman characters to gain a significant buff when on a team with other members of the group, with Black Bolt being the activator given his ability to activate the Terrigen Bomb in the comics.

The Inhumans also have a complicated history with many other Marvel characters that could come into play with Marvel Rivals Team-Ups outside of one another. For example, Crystal's history of working with The Fantastic Four would lend itself nicely to a Team-Up with Human Torch, and Black Bolt's status as a member of the Illuminati could give him Team-Ups with other members like Doctor Strange, Mr. Fantastic, and Iron Man. With how far the Inhumans' relationships with other Marvel characters reach, there would be near limitless possibilities for Team-Ups if members are added to Marvel Rivals in the future.

item.title: 8 Best Street Sport Games, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Street sports video games feature unique rules, team options, and innovative gameplay.
  • Titles like FIFA Street and Tony Hawk's Underground offer diverse experiences and exciting challenges in worldwide locations.
  • From a streetball battle to street hockey and football, these games deliver fun and engaging street sports action.

There is something about playing sports on the street that seems a perfect fit for video games. Perhaps it is a sense of nostalgia, from years gone by when many a childhood was spent outside playing various games with friends, improvising playing fields, avoiding hazards, and making up unique rules.

Various game series have popped up over the years, trying to fill this gap in the market, and while they have found commercial success, street sports games have generally lagged behind their more-traditional counterparts. Critically, these games are just as good, if not better, and here are some of the best, ranked by their general quality and popularity with fans.

8 Crash ‘n’ the Boys: Street Challenge

Olympic Sports On The Streets

Part of the Kunio Kun series of games, Crash ‘n’ the Boys: Street Challenge mixes the sporting aspect of Super Dodge Ball with the unbridled violence of River City Ransom . The story involves a snooty rich kid wanting to exact revenge on some of his classmates who defeated him in sports at school, which he does by organizing street sports with very relaxed rules.

The five teams in the game each have five members with their own strengths and weaknesses, and there are five sports in total, competed in this order:

  • 400m Hurdles – a simple footrace, but opponents can be kicked, or hurdles can be thrown at them.
  • Swimming – a simple swimming race, but opponents can be punched and dragged underwater.
  • Fighting Scene – an all-out street brawl with the loser being the combatant whose stamina is drained.
  • Hammer Throw – more like golf, featuring sand traps and water hazards as players keep throwing until they reach the goal.
  • Roof Top Jump – jumping across rooftops with a pole vault. Competitors are penalized if they fall through the gap.

7 Street Hockey '95

No Holds Barred Hockey Action

  • Platform: SNES
  • Released: 1994-11
  • Developer: GTE Entertainment
  • Genre: Sports

While other major sporting bodies have given their names to officially licensed street sports games, the NHL is still yet to follow suit. A North American exclusive for the SNES, Street Hockey ’95 scratches that hockey itch and brings the action to the streets, swapping ice skates for rollerblades as they play bruising games on cement.

There are nine unique characters to choose from when playing, and six distinct urban environments to play in, from construction sites filled with obstacles and ramps to empty swimming pools. Five different game modes also add their own twists on the rules, such as giving different points for different types of shots when scoring goals.

6 Street Sports Baseball

Kids Playing Baseball In The Neighborhood

  • Platforms: Apple II, Commodore 64, DOS, PC
  • Released: 1987
  • Developer: Epyx, Inc.
  • Genre: Sports

Bringing back childhood memories of playing bat and ball games on a makeshift playing field with friends, Street Sports Baseball is sure to evoke nostalgic feelings from many players. Choosing a team from 16 unique characters, each of whom is a local kid and has their own abilities, players can have full control over batting order and field position.

Since games occur in improvised locations, such as parking lots and backyards, certain hazards are present in the field of play. Tree stumps, trash cans, and hosepipes are all potential tripping hazards, but the split screen display with a full field view can give an early heads-up about potential dangers.

5 NBA Ballers

One-on-One Streetball Action

Inspired by the 1990s classic NBA Jam , NBA Ballers is a streetball game where players face off one-on-one, sometimes being joined by a third competitor to make it a three-way battle for supremacy. The goal is to reach 11 points or have the highest score when the time runs out, but showcasing a player’s skills builds up the “House” meter, which can trigger an instant win.

Featuring over 60 NBA players from the time of release, plus a further 24 legends like Larry Bird and Magic Johnson, this game is packed with star power. To top it all off, there is a “Rags to Riches” story mode, alleged to be the first story mode in a sports game licensed by a league.

4 NFL Street

Divisive Graphics, But Fun Gameplay

The exaggerated appearance of the players is not for everybody in NFL Street , but the gameplay is the main selling point. No fouls, no helmets, and no injuries mean that the action is ultra-violent and over the top, and the “Gamebreaker” meter ramps up the action even more, literally breaking the game.

NFL Challenge is the main game mode where players take an amateur team and build up their attributes through development points and equipment enhancement, while also unlocking new playing fields. Showboating and taunts are also highly encouraged, earning players points towards the Gamebreaker meter.

3 FIFA Street

A Stellar Reboot

The first entry in the series is still warmly regarded by many fans, even if critics at the time were not overly impressed, but following the lukewarm reception to the second and third entries, EA rebooted FIFA Street in 2012. This one proved to be a hit, adding more than fifty extra skills than in its predecessor, plus both national and club teams for the first time.

Six of the world’s top club competitions are fully licensed, allowing players to use their favorite teams in 5-a-side action. This allows players to take control of the world’s best professionals like Lionel Messi and Zlatan Ibrahimovic to test their mettle on the streets in locations like Rio de Janeiro and Venice.

2 NBA Street Vol. 2

The Best Streetball Game

Adding new tricks and dunks, NBA Street Vol. 2 improved upon the much-hyped first game. All 29 NBA teams from the 2002-03 season are available for use, as well as legends like Julius Irving and three different versions of Michael Jordan from various points in his stellar career.

This game also introduced a second “Gamebreaker” level, which is even more powerful than the first, causing opposition teams to lose points and the player’s team to gain even more. Widely regarded as the best aspect of this entry is the “Be A Legend” mode, where players create their own baller and take on the best streetball aficionados, unlocking new characters and other items along the way.

1 Tony Hawk’s Underground

Take To The Streets Around The Globe

Regarded by many as one of the best skateboarding games ever made, Tony Hawk’s Underground allows players to skate on the streets of many cities around the world, such as New Jersey and Moscow. Featuring a highly acclaimed full story mode and extensive customization options for the player character, there is plenty for players to sink their teeth into in this game.

The addition of being able to walk adds to freedom within the levels, allowing players to climb ladders and towers to perform tricks and skate back down them. Like the wider Tony Hawk series of skateboarding games, this entry added to the popularization and legitimization of the sport.

item.title: Hogwarts Legacy: 18 Character Mods You Should Try
item.description:
Summary

  • Mods enhance character customization with magical eyes, Victorian hairstyles, modern glasses, beards, makeup, and more.
  • Modding community offers an extensive array of new options for players seeking to improve character-creation experience.
  • Hogwarts Legacy fans can mod the game to create unique and immersive character appearances, outfits, and NPCs.

Hogwarts Legacy offers a lot of choices when it comes to character creation. From many different hairstyles to facial features and multiple color schemes. Players have been experimenting with the creation tool from the very launch of the game, even recreating famous characters from books and movies.

But of course, there are many improvements that could be made to enhance the character-creation experience. Mods offer a myriad of new options for players to enjoy. From expanding on the list of existing features to completely new ways to customize a character, mods can be a great choice for those looking to spruce up their gameplay.

Updated on February 6, 2025, by Mehrdad Khayyat: The Harry Potter universe has never gotten a chance like Hogwarts Legacy in video games, and this open-world experience not only lets players to explore the rich world of the books themselves, but also adjust them to their likings with a variety of mods available.

Thanks to the modding community, not only the players have managed to bring all the familiar characters to Hogwarts Legacy, but also go one step ahead and let the players deliver alternative looks to every NPC.

18 Unique Player Eye Shapes

Brings A Magical Touch To Character Appearances

  • Link to the Mod - uploaded by deleted171626058

Eyes are a key focal point for any character, and the world of Harry Potter is not without its own unique and interesting characters that have distinctive irises. From Harry’s characteristic green that mirrors his own mothers, to Mad-Eye Moody, to the everchanging Nymphadora Tonks.

This mod allows for even more variety, giving players an extra special choice of magical eyes. From cat-like slits to star-shaped irises, players can now give their character so much more flair and individuality, making them stand out in the most auspicious of crowds.

17 Victorian Hair Modpack

Adds A Victorian Touch To The Game

  • Link to the Mod - uploaded by swiz19

Picking out the perfect hairstyle for a character is always an important step, and no matter how many choices already exist, there can always be more. This mod adds 7 new hairstyles and does so in a unique way and setting.

Unlike many vanilla options, these hairdos stand out with their Victorian style, bringing a nuanced and even somewhat royal feel to a character. After all, who said that young wizards and witches can’t have proper taste for hairstyles?

16 Victorian Outfit Modpack

Bringing Gorgeous Victorian Clothing To Female Characters

  • Link to the Mod - uploaded by Swiz19

What's the point of a Victorian hairstyle without wearing a Victorian dress? This amazing mod pack adds 11 new and unique outfits for a female protagonist, all tailored based on Victorian clothing. The mod also comes with custom physics to avoid causing collision issues with the environment.

The good thing about this modpack is the fact that it comes with outfits for a variety of situations, from long, beautiful dresses for party nights to working-class outfits for maids. The colors of outfits, however, are not customizable.

15 Alternative Uniforms for NPCs

Refreshing Looks For The Game's Side Characters

  • Link to the Mod - uploaded by hyacinth13

Having students wear a uniform makes perfect sense, but the lack of any changes between years and seasons has left many players frustrated. This mod neatly fixes that problem, by adding new styles, seasonal outfits, and much more.

Whether players just want some more visual variety when replaying the game, or just overall a better and more immersive experience, this is a great mod that fleshes out this particular part of the game. With fresh looks and accessories, many beloved NPCs look leaps and bounds better than they used to.

14 Vanilla Ponytails

Reworking The Ponytails Of The Game

  • Link to the Mod - uploaded by hoax2

While the base game does feature a couple of ponytail hairstyles, this mod does a great job of expanding the list without being overwhelming. Using existing assets and remixing some of them, the author has added 5 new options to choose from.

After all, finding the right option can be difficult, and one never knows which one will be the perfect match for their style. The mod is perfectly compatible with many others, mimicking the physics of vanilla hairstyles when it comes to hats and clothes.

13 Soft Blush - Skin Replacement

A Realistic Skin Replacement Option

  • Link to the Mod - uploaded by ElineMods

One mod that has gained popularity is this skin complexion improvement mod. It changes the visual appearance of facial features and skin in the game, creating a smoother and shinier look for the character. This mod also adds a custom makeup pattern to some of the facial options.

This mod is a great addition for players who want to enhance the overall aesthetic of the game and expand on the available options when it comes to character creation. Originally, the uploader ElineMods created it to supplement another mod that replaces one of the default faces, which is available on the author’s page.

12 FFXV Male Hairs

Adding Some Japanese Vibe To The Heart Of Hogwarts

  • Link to the mod - uploaded by Klitschkat

Few gamers can claim they have no familiarity with the Final Fantasy series, and that's one big reason why this franchise usually has crossover mods with other games. However, bringing the hairstyles of Final Fantasy XV protagonist is something players barely would've expected.

This mod adds hairstyles of Noctis, Ignis, Gladio, and Prompto to the character creator menu of Hogwarts Legacy . Of course, it's a weird fit for the Harry Potter universe, but in the end, it's fantasy RPG meeting fantasy RPG, so not a big deal when looking at it this way!

The good news is hairstyles are pretty accurate and authentic, both in color and the way they have been 3D modeled, which must be a relief for die-hard fans of Final Fantasy XV .

11 Year Level - Change Your Height

Drastically Control Character Height

  • Link to the Mod - uploaded by HappyCG

For some reason, Hogwarts Legacy does not allow for customized height, which may be frustrating for some people who prefer to control all of the aspects of their character. That's where Year Level comes in, adding exactly that and a little more. This mod allows the player to adjust their height on the fly, letting players experiment with different sizes and even roleplay as different-year students.

It is a nice addition to the game, with a hilarious option to make the character absolutely tiny. Roleplaying as a cursed student, perhaps? From a towering seventh-year or a diminutive first-year, players can now enjoy the freedom to see the magical world from different perspectives.

10 Brighter Eyes

Adds In Vibrant Eyes

  • Link to the Mod - uploaded by 070ZeroSevenZero

This particular mod makes the colors of the character’s irises pop and almost glow, depending on the chosen option. With this addition, the customization and visual impact are taken to the next level, providing players with the means to make their characters even more mystifying and unique than ever.

This is a great option to add to any player’s mod setup, as it goes well with other character mods, as long as they don’t affect the default diffuse map for the eyes. From a little glow-up to the new magical centerpiece, this mod will enhance the look of any witch and wizard.

9 Extended Character Creator

Expands The List Of Character Creation Options

  • Link to the Mod - uploaded by AidenCharming

This is a mod that instantly adds a plethora of new options for the player, using the in-game assets that aren’t usually available for the main character. From new faces to new hairstyles, the mod adds more than 80 new options to choose from.

Finding just the right features for one’s imagined character can be quite a challenge at times, and expanding the list of available alternatives is always a delight. It’s also a nice addition that, unlike other mods, this one doesn’t replace any of the existing profiles and assets but adds the new options on top, which makes customization much easier.

8 Modern Glasses

Helping To Recreate Modern Faces More Accurately

  • Link to the mod - Uploaded by Azuriewolf

Many gamers wear glasses, and it is always such a disappointment that character creation systems in some games ignore glasses. Thankfully, this is not the case with Hogwarts Legacy , but still, a lack of modern glasses is noticeable, which is not even the case, regarding the game's setting.

That being said, nothing should stop players from creating a character just identical to themselves, and the Modern Glasses pack is a great tool for that. This pack adds a variety of glasses modeled based on some of the most popular frames.

7 Beards and More

Gives The Option To Rock Fullblown Facial Hair

  • Link to the Mod - uploaded by DefaultKashou

After all, what kind of wizard doesn’t want a beard? With this mod, the players can finally choose any facial hair style for their character, from a little unshaved scruff to a luscious, full-grown beard. The facial hair matches the head, so any color goes!

The beards are fully animated, gloriously swaying with the character. While some, especially younger-looking preset faces might look a tad silly with a sailor’s beard, it isn’t difficult to make it quite believable. As always, carefully read the mod descriptions, as some may poorly interact with similar ones and cause crashes and other errors.

6 Character Editor

Enter Character Editor At Any Given Point

  • Link to the Mod - uploaded by nathdev

This mod allows changing the appearance of the character at any point in the game. It can be quite upsetting to find out that certain features don’t look the same in-game or to want a new hairstyle and be unable to change it.

This mod fixes that problem with its own in-game UI. The changing process is easy and intuitive, allowing for adaptive gameplay tweaks. After all, in the magical world of Harry Potter , such changes come effortlessly to the characters. With a flick of a wand, characters can change their hairstyle and looks, while potions and certain abilities even allow for shapeshifting, so it’s only natural to add the ability to the game.

5 Makeup Emporium

A Large Collection Of Makeup Options

  • Link to the Mod - uploaded by Aloyx

This makeup mod is a fantastic addition to the game, allowing players to have more choices when it comes to creating their character's appearance. With the mod installed, players can choose from a wider range of colors and styles for eye shadow, lipstick, blush, and more.

This adds a much-needed layer of customization to the game, allowing players to express their creativity and individuality even more. With this many options to choose from, the new possibilities for characters are endless. Whether one wants to create a bold and colorful look or a subtle and natural one, this mod has got it covered.

4 Paler And Darker Skins For Player Characters

A Greater Diversity Of Character Creation Options

  • Link to the Mod - uploaded by BobG123

As the name implies, this mod that expands on skin colors adds a whole new level of diversity and inclusivity to the game. With more options for skin tones, players can create characters that better reflect themselves or the world around them. This mod goes beyond just adding a few new shades; it includes a range of undertones and variations, making it easier to create unique and realistic characters.

The addition of new skin tones also means that players can explore different cultural backgrounds and create characters that reflect a wider range of ethnicities. This mod is a great way to enhance the immersive experience of the game and encourages players to create characters that are truly unique and meaningful to them.

3 Vessnelle's Complexions

Even More Complexion Options

  • Link to the Mod - uploaded by Vessnelle

Another mod that expands the existing complexion options modifying the skin tones, textures, and appearances. Finding just the right match for one’s character is never easy, especially with limited options to choose from. This mod will allow players to create characters with a wider range of skin complexions, enabling them to better reflect the diversity of the magical world.

The added complexions also look a tad more realistic, with better textures and features, making the characters feel much more grounded. It is important to note that many skin mods do interfere with each other, and players should carefully read the instructions and notes of each mod.

2 Companions

No One Needs To Go Into The Forest Alone

  • Link to the Mod - uploaded by hoax2

It is almost surprising that the option isn’t there in the vanilla version. Taking memorable characters on adventures is one of the most fun aspects of RPG games, and this mod does a fantastic job of filling that role in the game.

Companions aren’t just for show either. They will assist the player in combat, mimic certain spells, and occasionally even comment on their surroundings! Overall it is an incredibly immersive and filling option for those who enjoy having their adventures in a party.

1 School Makeup

A High-Quality Collection Of Makeup Options

  • Link to the Mod - uploaded by Aliize

This is a great addition to any player’s toolkit; it is one of the most downloaded Character mods available. It focuses on combining skin tones, make-up, and other features to improve the look of existing presets, as well as add many more of its own.

This mod has become incredibly popular among gamers who want to personalize their Hogwarts student's looks and create a sense of individuality. Its ease of use and ability to enhance the player's gaming experience have made it a must-have for any Harry Potter fan who wants to add a touch of magic to their gameplay.
